portfolioItems.heading: HeapViz
portfolioItems.description: My latest personal project has been a visualization engine for Chrome memory profiles. I published an article series on the making of HeapViz. Chrome heap profiles are very large, and I needed to use all of the performance-enhancing tools at my disposal to effectively render them, including WebGL, WebAssembly, and WebWorkers. Building HeapViz has been the challenge of my career, but I have learned and grown an incredible amount from the experienve.

portfolioItems.heading: StorySystem
portfolioItems.description: In early 2019, I decided to create a tabletop role-playing game. I built the web presence for the game from scratch, using a bunch of web technologies to accomplish article editing and upload, image upload, and scalable serving.

portfolioItems.heading: T&M Travel
portfolioItems.description: My wife and I are spending most of 2020 traveling the world. This blog documents our travels, and shows off our design and development skills.

portfolioItems.heading: Rubic's Cube
portfolioItems.description:
In the fall of 2015 I caught the WebGL bug and had to take a stab at doing some basic 3D programming. I created an interactive Rubic's cube from scratch, using a homebrewed framework built on top of ThreeJS.

I had a lot of learning to do, both about 3D modelling (I used Blender) and about spatial geometry. It took me a few passes, but I got the event system robust and extensible, and the game logic correctly implemented.

portfolioItems.heading: VidSketch
portfolioItems.description:
VidSketch is a Chrome App used to capture the user's desktop, add simple text and shape overlays, and transcode the resulting video into a shareable format. It won the Rosetta intra-company Winter 2014 hackathon.

VidSketch is built on Backbone/Marionette, and uses WebRTC with RecordRTC, HTML5 Canvas with Fabric.js, and FFMPEG to build a robust and useful interactive desktop capture application.

portfolioItems.heading: ALDI Road Trip
portfolioItems.description:
This was another collaboration with the designers at StudioGood, to launch an interactive graphic to promote ALDI products alongside the launch of their blog refresh (also authored by me).

The primary technology used was SVG, along with smart responsive development practices. The overall result was a fun graphic and pretty page that looked great across all devices and browsers.
